alert.note: Alert for Lackawanna; Pike; Wayne (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 07 at 8:59PM EDT until July 07 at 10:00PM EDT by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM EDT THIS EVENING FOR EAST CENTRAL LACKAWANNA, NORTHWESTERN PIKE AND SOUTHERN WAYNE COUNTIES... At 859 PM EDT, local law enforcement reported flash flooding. Over a foot of water on Catterson road has been reported along with water and debris on the roadway near Ledgerdale. Between 1.5 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Law enforcement reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Blooming Grove, Paupack, Sterling, Hawley, Arlington, Ledgerdale, Lake Ariel, Greentown, Tresslarville, Mount Cobb, South Canaan, Lakeville, Headley, Newfoundland, Panther, Promised Land State Park, Kimbles, Drinker, Quicktown and Cortez. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Move to higher ground now. Act quickly to protect your life. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
